messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:42): I don't understand what the "IE10" column in http://crockford.com/javascript/performance.html represents
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:42): now I do
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:42): "relative to IE10"?
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (19:43): that's my understanding too
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:44): funny that Crockford has such deep insight into what JS engine developers are doing
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:44): "lacking credible benchmarks, engine developers are tuning to what they have"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:44): if he says so, I guess it must be true
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:44): because he is a true sage
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:44): Lacking credible benchmarks, I decided that my program was obviously a credible benchmark
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:45): Because I entirely missed the point of that Microsoft paper
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (19:45): I'm surprised about the difference between IE9 and IE10
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (19:46): I don't remember any announcement around JS perf in IE10
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (19:46): maybe it's "native ES5" ?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:46): JS engine developers are clearly just a bunch of asses who have no clue what they are doing
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:46): Since Crockford helpfully made it easy to rerun his test you cantry and reproduce his results
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:46): they should all just be replaced by instances of Crockford
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:47): browser projects should all hire Crockford to come in and educate their dev teams about how to develop JS engines propertly
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:47): that would be fun
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:47): I would pay real money personally to attend such sessions
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:48): Crockford is like Eric Clapton during the Cream days
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:49): except he doesn't even need a Jack Bruce and a Ginger Baker
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:49): he is a world-class power trio solely on his own
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:49): like the holy trinity
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (19:49): he's even on tour
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:49): sweet
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (19:50): coming to brooklyn to speak at etsy next week
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:50): well, count yourself blessed
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:51): it will be the greatest thing that Brooklyn has seen since Walt Whitman
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (19:51): been a long time coming
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:52): or at least since RZA
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:53): Jim Jarmusch should do a "Coffee and Cigarettes" reprise with Crockford and RZA and DZA
